comentarios: Este formato est√° escrito para Postgresql
pre: CREATE TABLE ${comunasTable}(${comunaId} integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL, ${comunaName} character varying(20), ${comunaProvinciaId} integer);
ALTER TABLE public.${comunasTable} OWNER TO postgres;
CREATE TABLE ${provinciasTable}(${provinciaId} integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL, ${provinciaName} character varying(23), ${provinciaRegionId} integer);
ALTER TABLE public.${provinciasTable} OWNER TO postgres;
CREATE TABLE ${regionesTable}(${regionId} integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL, ${regionName} character varying(50));
ALTER TABLE public.${regionesTable} OWNER TO postgres;
post: ALTER TABLE ONLY ${comunasTable} ADD CONSTRAINT ${comunaPk} PRIMARY KEY (${comunaId});
ALTER TABLE ONLY ${provinciasTable} ADD CONSTRAINT ${provinciaPk} PRIMARY KEY (${provinciaId});
ALTER TABLE ONLY ${regionesTable} ADD CONSTRAINT ${regionPk} PRIMARY KEY (${regionId});
ALTER TABLE ONLY ${comunasTable} ADD CONSTRAINT ${comunaProvinciaFk} FOREIGN KEY (${comunaProvinciaId}) REFERENCES ${provinciasTable}(${provinciaId});
ALTER TABLE ONLY ${provinciasTable} ADD CONSTRAINT ${provinciaRegionFk} FOREIGN KEY (${provinciaRegionId}) REFERENCES ${regionesTable}(${regionId});
REVOKE ALL ON SCHEMA public FROM PUBLIC;
REVOKE ALL ON SCHEMA public FROM postgres;
GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA public TO postgres;
GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA public TO PUBLIC;
